monster.name: Space Hamster

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: the hamster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage p. 251

monster.name: Wooden Donkey

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The donkey is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The donkey has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage p. 84

monster.name: Barnacle Bess

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Bess can breathe air and water.

action.name: Claw
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11).
Bess has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

monster.description: Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 220

monster.name: Fish

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The fish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 224

monster.name: Giant Coral Snake

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the target begins to hallucinate and is afflicted with a dmg|8|madness). The effect lasts 10 minutes.

monster.description:
Comfortable on land or in water, these brilliantly colored snakes are renowned for their potent and hallucinogenic venom. They are most often found in coastal caves. In the abandoned chambers of the hermitage in Tammeraut's Fate, these giant serpents feed on any creature that crosses their path.
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 236

monster.name: Giant Sea Eel

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The eel can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Snaking predators lurking in the dark waters of the ocean, these kelp-colored beasts serve as guards and mounts for the locathah (including those found in Danger at Dunwater).
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 237

monster.name: Giant White Moray Eel

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The eel can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 216

monster.name: Sahuagin Hatchling Swarm
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Seething
trait.text: Once it enters combat, the swarm deals 10 slashing damage to itself at the end of its turn if it did not make an attack on that turn. This damage ignores resistance, and it cannot reduce the swarm to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.description:
Roiling through the waters in The Final Enemy, these swarms of sahuagin hatchlings are dangerous to any creatures they encounter. Other sahuagin avoid the swarms, while the individual members devour one another until only the strongest hatchlings are left alive to grow to maturity.
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 250, Locathah Rising

monster.name: Hellwasp Grub

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monster.description: Source: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 95

monster.name: Peacock

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The peacock has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The peacock has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacock's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 195

monster.name: Skeletal Rats
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.description: Source: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 23

monster.name: Traxigor
monster.resist: damage from spells; nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, slashing (from stoneskin)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Traxigor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Traxigor is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Traxigor can cast disguise self and invisibility at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
At will: disguise self, invisibility.
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor*, magic missile 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, lightning bolt 4th level (3 slots): banishment, fire shield, stoneskin* 5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, scrying, wall of force 6th level (1 slots): globe of invulnerability 7th level (1 slots): plane shift 8th level (1 slots): mind blank* 9th level (1 slots): time stop
*Traxigor casts these spells on itself before combat.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Variant: Familiars
action.text: Any spellcaster that can cast the find familiar spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a crawling claw, imp, pseudodragon, or quasit.

monster.spells: disguise self, invisibility, fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, detect magic, identify, mage armor, magic missile, detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step, counterspell, fly, lightning bolt, banishment, fire shield, stoneskin, cone of cold, scrying, wall of force, globe of invulnerability, plane shift, mind blank, time stop
monster.description:
Traxigor was polymorphed into an otter years ago, and decided he preferred the new form to his original one (that of a wizened old man). His otter form was made permanent by a wish spell.
Stat Block Origin: Archmage Source: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 50

monster.name: Skeletal Giant Owl
monster.languages: Giant Owl, understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak them

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The owl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Infernal Machine Rebuild p. 33

monster.name: Skeletal Polar Bear

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Infernal Machine Rebuild p. 34

monster.name: Two-Headed Crocodile

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The two-headed crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: The two-headed crocodile has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: When one of the crocodile's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The two-headed crocodile makes two attacks with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12).
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and that head of the crocodile can't bite another target.

monster.description: Source: Infernal Machine Rebuild p. 89

monster.name: Clawfoot

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The clawfoot has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the clawfoot's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the clawfoot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The clawfoot makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.description:
Clawfoot dinosaurs are two-legged saurians with sharp teeth and toe claws that resemble deadly sickles. They are imposing creatures, about the size of a tall human, and are fierce enough to take down even larger prey. In the wild, an untrained clawfoot can easily hold its own in combat, but they are even fiercer when hunting in packs. Their instinct for pack structure has made these dinosaurs a traditional war mount for the halflings of the Talenta Plains, with clawfoots quickly and eagerly responding to training and control.
Dinosaurs: Dinosaurs are widespread on Eberron, particularly in Q'barra, the Talenta Plains, Xen'drik, and Argonnessen. Smaller dinosaurs are the rule in Q'barra and the Talenta Plains, including varieties commonly used by Talenta halflings as mounts.
Source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 289, Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron p. 81

monster.name: Fastieth

trait.name: Quickness (Recharge 5-6)
trait.text: The fastieth can take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Fastieth are human-sized, two-legged saurians with large eyes, brightly colored and patterned scales, and strong legs. They are the most common mounts of the halflings of the Talenta Plains, bred for speed. Although too small to bear larger riders, a fastieth can carry a halfling with light gear easily and at a good pace. Fastieths are typically stubborn creatures, so specimens with an even temperament are prized among the Talenta tribes. Being herbivores, fastieths prefer to flee rather than fight. However, even though not trained for battle, they can deliver a vicious bite if pressed.
Dinosaurs: Dinosaurs are widespread on Eberron, particularly in Q'barra, the Talenta Plains, Xen'drik, and Argonnessen. Smaller dinosaurs are the rule in Q'barra and the Talenta Plains, including varieties commonly used by Talenta halflings as mounts.
Source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 289

monster.name: Awakened White Moose

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the moose moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The moose has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The moose makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

action.name: Antlers
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
A white moose is attacking loggers in the forest near Lonelywood. The town's logging industry is essential to the growth and survival of Ten-Towns, and Speaker Nimsy Huddle has assured the other speakers that Lonelywood's "moose problem" will be dealt with in short order. Hunters have been dispatched to kill the moose, but it has eluded them so far. From what the hunters have seen, their prey is smarter than the average moose, and its white hide makes it hard to spot in the snow. What they don't know is that the moose is using a magic mirror as a scrying device to show it where its enemies are.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 82

monster.name: Chimeric Baboon

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The baboon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage, plus an extra 3 (1d6) poison damage.

monster.description: Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Chimeric Cat

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

monster.description:
The chimeric cat has antennae that grant it blindsight and tremorsense out to a range of 60 feet
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Chimeric Fox

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Chimeric Creation
trait.text: The fox has fur that changes color to match its surroundings, giving it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description:
The white arctic foxes of Icewind Dale live in burrows and are acclimated to cold weather. They prowl the outskirts of Ten-Towns and nearby forests for food, hunting hares or stealing fish. These timid creatures avoid contact with humanoids, but they are sometimes used as mounts by chwingas.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Chimeric Hare
monster.speed: walk 20 ft., burrow 5 ft., fly 30 ft.

trait.name: Escape
trait.text: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

monster.description:
Snowshoe hares are gentle herbivores that live in burrows throughout Icewind Dale. They have shorter ears than other hares and are acclimated to cold weather. Chimeric hares have feathered wings.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Chimeric Rat

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Chimeric Creation
trait.text: The rat has gills, iridescent scales, and the ability to breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Chimeric Weasel

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Chimeric Creation
trait.text: The weasel has glowing eyes that emit bright light out in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 246

monster.name: Fox

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description:
The white arctic foxes of Icewind Dale live in burrows and are acclimated to cold weather. They prowl the outskirts of Ten-Towns and nearby forests for food, hunting hares or stealing fish. These timid creatures avoid contact with humanoids, but they are sometimes used as mounts by Chwinga.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 288

monster.name: Giant Walrus

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The walrus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The walrus makes two attacks: one with its body flop and one with its tusks.

action.name: Body Flop
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tusks
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Giant walruses are enormous, ill-tempered creatures as big as elephants. A typical adult specimen weighs at least 12,000 pounds.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 312

monster.name: Hare

trait.name: Escape
trait.text: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

monster.description:
Snowshoe hares are gentle herbivores that live in burrows throughout Icewind Dale. They have shorter ears than other hares and are acclimated to cold weather.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 294

monster.name: Kingsport

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: Kingsport can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Scrivenscry is an arcanaloth who always refers to itself in the third person. It has a fondness for black licorice, strips of which it keeps in the pockets of its robe. The fiend is attended by Kingsport, a blind, albino giant penguin under the effect of an awaken spell.
Scrivenscry's anxious penguin servant, Kingsport, was promised a life of enlightenment. The truth is that Kingsport was turned into Scrivenscry's lackey, who lives in fear of his cruel, unpredictable master. The blind giant penguin hopes to be free of the arcanaloth one day.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 243

monster.name: Knucklehead Trout

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The trout can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The tasty and tenacious knucklehead trout can't easily be caught in nets. Moreover, using a line to reel in such a strong fish is a significant undertaking. Incautious fishers who get pulled into freezing water can quickly die, particularly if they're weighed down by heavy furs and cloaks.
A male knucklehead trout can weigh 70 pounds or more. The females tend to be smaller, weighing about 50 pounds. Both are prized for their ivory-like bones.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 295

monster.name: Mountain Goat

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the goat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
Mountain goats are found throughout the Spine of the World and on the slopes of Kelvin's Cairn, their thick fur and layers of body fat protecting them from the extreme cold. They are expert climbers, able to leap and bound up sheer slopes.
Mountain goats are territorial but easily placated with offerings of food. Their stubbornness makes them difficult to domesticate.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 304

monster.name: Reindeer

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the reindeer moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 107

monster.name: Seal

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The seal can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The seal has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description:
The seals native to the Sea of Moving Ice often beach themselves on ice floes and rocky shores. They are acclimated to the cold weather and feed primarily on small fish, squid, and clams. Seal pups have yellowish-white fur, which turns silvery gray as they enter adulthood.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 308

monster.name: Sperm Whale

trait.name: Echolocation
trait.text: The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of the whale's turns. If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage, or 37 (6d6 + 16) bludgeoning damage if the target is an object.

monster.description:
Sperm whales are toothed aquatic mammals that can grow to be up to 70 feet long. Their natural predators include whalers and fellow leviathans, such as dragon turtles and krakens.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 309

monster.name: Walrus

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The walrus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Tusks
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Walruses are bulky marine mammals that favor arctic climates and communicate by grunting and roaring. A typical adult specimen weighs at least 2,000 pounds. Humans hunt them for their meat, fat, skin, bones, and tusks.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 312

monster.name: Beast of the Land

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5 + five times your ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your ranger level)

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the beast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a maul attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: You can add your proficiency bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the beast makes.

action.name: Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 2 slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

monster.name: Beast of the Sea

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5 + five times your ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your ranger level)

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The beast can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: You can add your proficiency bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the beast makes.

action.name: Binding Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 2 + PB piercing damage or 1d6 + 2 + PB bludgeoning damage (your choice), and the target is grappled (escape DC equal to your spellcasting save DC). Until this grapple ends, the beast can't use this attack on another target.

monster.description: Source: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

monster.name: Beast of the Sky

trait.text: 4 + four times your ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your ranger level)

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The beast doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: You can add your proficiency bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the beast makes.

action.name: Shred
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d4 + 3 + PB slashing damage

monster.description: Source: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

monster.name: Bestial Spirit
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 20 + 5 for each spell level above 2nd

trait.name: Water Breathing (Water Only)
trait.text: The beast can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Flyby (Air Only)
trait.text: The beast doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Pack Tactics (Land and Water Only)
trait.text: The beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The beast makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

monster.name: Swarm of Maggots
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Infestation
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. A creature damaged by the swarm must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or contract a disease. Each time the diseased creature finishes a long rest, roll a d6 to determine the disease's effect:
1-2. The creature is blinded until it finishes a long rest. 3-4. The creature's hit point maximum decreases by 5 (2d4), and the reduction can't be removed until the disease ends. The creature dies if its hit point maximum drops to 0. 5-6. The creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until it finishes its next long rest. The disease lasts until it's removed by magic or until the creature rolls the same random effect for the disease two long rests in a row.

monster.description: Source: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 247

monster.name: Swarm of Scarabs
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., burrow 30 ft., climb 30 ft.
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Skeletonize
trait.text: If the swarm starts its turn in the same space as a dead creature that is Large or smaller, the corpse is destroyed, leaving behind only equipment and bones (or exoskeleton).

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Ravenous Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, scarabs burrow into its body, and the creature takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can use an action to kill or remove the scarabs with fire or a weapon that deals piercing damage, causing 1 damage of the appropriate type to the target. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the swarm's piercing damage dies

monster.description: Source: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 247

monster.name: Giant Dragonfly

trait.name: Drone
trait.text: When it beats its wings, the dragonfly emits a loud droning sound that can be heard out to a range of 120 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The dragonfly halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 234

monster.name: Giant Snail

trait.name: Salt Osmosis
trait.text: Whenever the snail starts its turn in contact with a pound or more of salt, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage. Using an action to sprinkle a pound of salt on the snail deals 1d4 necrotic damage to it immediately and another 1d4 necrotic damage to it at the start of its next turn (after which the salt rubs off), provided the snail has not withdrawn into its shell.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to its AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 234

monster.name: Giant Swan

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The swan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The swan makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 38

monster.name: Pollenella the Honeybee

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 135

monster.name: Giant Canary

action.name: Peck
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons p. 204

monster.name: Relic Sloth

action.name: Claws
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15).
The relic sloth can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

reaction.name: Slow but Sturdy
reaction.text: When the relic sloth is subjected to an effect that would move it out of its current space or knock it prone, it is neither moved nor knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos p. 210

monster.name: Bristled Moorbounder

trait.name: Bladed Hide
trait.text: At the start of each of its turns, the moorbounder deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The moorbounder makes one Blades attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Blades
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
A weird and deadly offshoot of the moorbounder has rows of long, bladelike bristles covering its sleek body. The creature uses these blades to slash nearby creatures to ribbons. However, these blades make the bristled moorbounder less suitable as a mount.
Moorbounders: Predators that stalk the marshlands and muddy foothills of Xhorhas, moorbounders are regarded as dangerous killers by those who try to avoid them on their travels- and as prized mounts by those willing to capture and train them. Though the process of domesticating a moorbounder is fraught with peril, these creatures can become favored hunting companions and powerful war mounts. Moorbounders hunt with elongated tusks and retractable claws. With a vague resemblance to large hunting cats, their muscular bodies are built for combat, granting them incredible prowess at leaping and a running speed that makes them dominant carnivores.
Source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep p. 203

monster.name: Moonshark

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Silver Spear
trait.text: A character within 5 feet of the shark can use an action to try to dislodge the spear, doing so with a successful DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check. While the spear is lodged in the shark, the shark glows with silvery illumination, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the shark misses, it can use a bonus action to swim up to 25 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.description:
The silver spear lodged in the shark's hide has been enchanted by the divine power of Sehanine the Moon Weaver.
Source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep p. 33

monster.name: Moorbounder

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
Moorbounders: Predators that stalk the marshlands and muddy foothills of Xhorhas, moorbounders are regarded as dangerous killers by those who try to avoid them on their travels- and as prized mounts by those willing to capture and train them. Though the process of domesticating a moorbounder is fraught with peril, these creatures can become favored hunting companions and powerful war mounts. Moorbounders hunt with elongated tusks and retractable claws. With a vague resemblance to large hunting cats, their muscular bodies are built for combat, granting them incredible prowess at leaping and a running speed that makes them dominant carnivores.
Source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep p. 203

monster.name: Young Horizonback Tortoise

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The young horizonback tortoise can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.name: Aurochs

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage. If the aurochs moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone if it is a creature.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

monster.name: Deep Roth

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The roth is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Gore

action.name: Dancing Lights
action.text: The roth casts dancing lights, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.name: Dimetrodon

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 95, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 139

monster.name: Dolphin

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the dolphin moved at least 30 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 97, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Swarm of Rot Grubs
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned.
At the end of each of the poisoned target's turns, the target takes 3 (1d6) poison damage. Whenever the poisoned target takes fire damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the poisoned target ends its turn with 0 hit points, it dies.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 237, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw

monster.name: Koi Prawn

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the prawn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The prawn can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Journeys through the Radiant Citadel p. 26

monster.name: Rooster

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The rooster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Journeys through the Radiant Citadel p. 206

monster.name: Giant Space Hamster

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Space hamsters resemble their terrestrial kin, both in their appearance and general demeanor, and they come in a variety of colors.
Giant space hamsters are cute, plant-eating rodents as big as brown bears. They tend to avoid other creatures, especially threatening ones, but they can be trained to serve as mounts and beasts of burden. Gnomes have tried to build spelljamming ships powered by giant space hamster wheels, so far without success.
Source: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space - Boo's Astral Menagerie p. 56

monster.name: Space Eel

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The eel doesn't require air.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: If it isn't attached to a creature, the eel makes one Bite attack and one Tail Spine attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the eel attaches to the target.
While attached, the eel can't make Bite attacks. Instead, the target takes 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage at the start of each of the eel's turns. The eel can detach itself as a bonus action. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the eel.

action.name: Tail Spine
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.
Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description:
Space eels avoid confrontations with larger creatures unless the eels are starving. These 5-foot-long scavengers might trail a spelljamming ship and feed on barnacles they detach from the ship's hull. Wildspace hunters try to catch and kill the eels for their meat-a task easier to describe than to accomplish.
Source: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space - Boo's Astral Menagerie p. 55

monster.name: Space Guppy

trait.name: Air Envelope
trait.text: If it has at least 1 hit point, the guppy can generate an air envelope around itself when in a vacuum. This air envelope can sustain the guppy and one other Tiny creature in its space indefinitely.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The guppy doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Tail Slap
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
Space guppies are 2- to 3-foot-long, fish-like creatures that glide through Wildspace and the Astral Sea. Chwinga astronauts, sprites, and other Tiny creatures occasionally use space guppies as mounts.
Source: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space - Boo's Astral Menagerie p. 55

monster.name: Space Mollymawk

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The mollymawk doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The mollymawk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Space mollymawks are as common in Wildspace as albatrosses are on the Material Plane. They perch on the hulls of spelljamming ships and move from one ship's air envelope to another's when they need to.
A fully grown specimen is 3 feet tall with a 10-foot wingspan, and it eats whatever it can scavenge. If it finds a reliable food source, it lingers in the area (usually around a ship) until the food becomes scarce. Superstitious Wildspace voyagers consider it bad luck to kill a space mollymawk.
Source: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space - Boo's Astral Menagerie p. 57

monster.name: Space Swine

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Space swine are a species of winged boar bred by dohwars (See "Dohwar") for a variety of uses. They can serve as mounts for Small creatures, and they also make fine trackers and capable beasts of burden. Space swine that are trained for battle are typically outfitted with half-plate barding and are referred to as death squealers.
A fully grown specimen stands 3 feet high at the shoulder and is 5 to 6 feet long. Space swine eat just about anything, but they prefer truffles. A space swine also tastes delicious when roasted and served with applesauce.
Source: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space - Boo's Astral Menagerie p. 57

monster.name: Spotted Lion

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the lion moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the lion can make another Rend attack against it as a bonus action.

monster.description:
Roughly twice the size of a common lion, a spotted lion has a dusky coat and mane, both speckled with charcoal-colored spots. Spotted lions gather in prides to hunt enormous prey ranging from giant elk to mammoths. Stone and cloud giants often keep these massive beasts as pets and hunting companions.
Source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants p. 177

monster.name: Titanothere

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The titanothere is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the titanothere moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition if it is a creature.

monster.description:
Titanotheres are a family of enormous mammals related to rhinoceroses. Some of them lack any horns on the face, while others have one, two, or more horns of various shapes and sizes. Some have rough, almost stony skin; some have horny plates; and some have thick, shaggy fur. These creatures are united by their tremendous stature, their herding behavior, and their irritable disposition.
Source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants p. 185
